Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Tavola Rotonda “The times they’re a-changing. Vent’anni di riforme delle pensioni”, Facoltà di Scienze Politiche, Università degli Studi di Milano, 3 marzo 2010. Presentazione del paper: Riforma delle pensioni nell’Europa centrale, orientale e sudorientale: aspetti di policy e applicazione teorica

Irish ProShare Association Conference on the Role of Financial Participation in the Provision of Pensions, Dublin, 30 April 2010. Presentazione del paper: Cross-Border Operations of IORPs: the Route to an EU Single Market for Occupational Pensions

Pension Privatization in Crisis?, FP7 GUSTO Workshop, University of Warwick, 26-27 May 2010. Presentazione del paper: EU and Supplementary Pensions: Instruments for Integration and the Market for Occupational Pensions in Europe (Igor Guardiancich and David Natali)

Institutional Change in Advanced Democracies. Workshop organised at the Robert Schuman Centre for Advanced Studies, Florence, 8-9 June 2010. Presentazione del paper: Institutional Survival and Return: Examples from the New Pension Orthodoxy

CGIL e INCA per i diritti in Italia e in Europa, Seminario CGIL-INCA, Rome, 28 ottobre 2010. Intervento al dibattito: L'evoluzione dei sistemi pensionistici in Europa e le questioni poste dal Libro Verde.
La previdenza complementare italiana nel contesto europeo. Quale futuro?, CdLM, Milan0, 14 dicembre 2010. Intervento al dibattito: La previdenza pubblica in Europa.

The Causes, Consequences and Meaning of Transnationalization. 18th International Conference of Europeanists. Barcelona, Spain, 20-22 June 2011. Presentazione del paper: A Stable State? Frozen Compromises and Patronage Cycles in Central and East European Pension Reform (Igor Guardiancich and Mitchell Orenstein).

SASE 23rd Annual Conference. Transformations of Contemporary Capitalism: Actors, Institutions, Processes. Universidad Autónoma de Madrid, 23-25 June 2011. Presentazione del paper: Pensions and the EU: Beyond the Divide between Economic and Social Europe (Igor Guardiancich and David Natali)

Quarta conferenza annuale ESPAnet Italia: Innovare il welfare: Percorsi di trasformazione in Italia e in Europe, Milano, 29 settembre - 1 ottobre 2011. Presentazione del paper: A Stable State? Political Cycles and Stability in the Implementation of Radical Pension Reforms in Central and Eastern Europe (Igor Guardiancich and Mitchell Orenstein)

Pension outcomes, FP7 GUSTO Project. Johns Hopkins SAIS Bologna Centre, Bologna, 18-19 November 2011. Presentazione del paper: Reframing Supplementary Pension Portability in Europe (Igor Guardiancich and David Natali)
Political Economy Research Group, Central European University. Budapest, 5 December 2011. Presentazione del paper: The Uncertain Future of Slovenian Exceptionalism.
A Europe of Diversities. 19th International Conference of Europeanists. Boston, USA, 22-24 March 2012. Presentazione del paper: Poland: Are Flexible Labour Markets Ready for Individualized Pensions?

Reforming Pension Systems in Europe and Central Asia. A Joint European Commission - World Bank Conference, Brussels, 25-26 June 2012. Presentazione del paper: The Political Economy of Pension Reform (Igor Guardiancich and Kent R. Weaver)

ETUC/ETUI workshop: Challenges and Future Perspectives of Pension Funds in Europe, Brussels, 19 February 2013. Intervento al dibattito: Pension Privatization in CEE: World Bank’s Failures and European Inconsistencies.

International Monetary Fund, Fiscal Affairs and European Departments Conference: Designing fiscally sustainable and equitable pension systems in emerging Europe in the post-crisis world. Vienna, 18 March 2013. Presentazione del paper: Public Pension Reforms: Experiences and Challenges to Attain Equitable Outcomes.
Graduate Student Political Economy Workshop, Central European University. Budapest, 6-7 June 2013. Intervento al dibattito: Dualization in East Central Europe? (Concept and Polish Example)
10th ILERA European Congress "Imagining New Employment Relations and New Solidarities", Amsterdam, the Netherlands, 20-22 June 2013. Presentazione del paper: Poland: the New Pension Mix
The Welfare State in Portugal in the Age of Austerity, ISEG. Lisbon, 9-10 May 2014. Presentazione del paper: Portability of Supplementary Pension Rights in Europe: A Breakthrough?

SASE's 26th Annual Meeting, Northwestern University and University of Chicago. Chicago, 10-12 July 2014. Presentazione del paper: Welfare States in Post-Socialist Europe: A Not-So-Long Goodbye to Bismarck

Settima conferenza annuale ESPAnet Italia: Sfide alla cittadinanza e trasformazione dei corsi di vita: precarietà, invecchiamento e migrazioni, Torino, 18-20 settembre 2014. Presentazione del paper: Portability of Supplementary Pension Rights in Europe: A Lowest Common Denominator Solution

Annual Meeting Of The Danish Society For European Studies, Aarhus University. Aarhus, 25-26 September 2014. Presentazione del paper: When A Partial Reform Equilibrium Turns Bad: The Tale of Slovenia’s Collapse
Political Economy Research Group, Central European University. Budapest, 27 October 2014. Presentazione del paper: When A Partial Reform Equilibrium Turns Bad: The Tale of Slovenia’s Collapse.

2015 Annual ESPAnet Conference: The Lost and the New Worlds of Welfare. The Centre for Welfare State Research, University of Southern Denmark, Odense, Denmark, 3-5 September 2015. Organizzatore (con P. Marx, R. Careja, P. Starke, M. Wulfgramm, C. Nguyen, L. Moreno, P. Vanhuysse, K. Petersen)

17th ILERA World Congress "The Changing World of Work: Implications for Labour and Employment Relations and Social Protection", Cape Town, South Africa, 7-11 September 2015. Presentazione del paper: Portability of Supplementary Pensions Rights in Europe: Challenges, Opportunities and Lessons to Be Drawn

Ottava conferenza annuale ESPAnet Italia: Welfare in Italia e welfare globale: esperienze e modelli di sviluppo a confronto, Salerno, 17-19 settembre 2015. Presentazione del paper: A Single Market for Occupational Pensions in Europe: Going Pan-European through the IORP Directive (Igor Guardiancich and Matteo Jessoula)

Tripartite Knowledge-Sharing Conference on ‘Post-Crisis Social Dialogue: Good Practices in the EU-28, ILO and European Commission, Sénat – Palais du Luxembourg, Paris, 20 May. Presentazione del libro: Post Crisis Social Dialogue – Best and Innovative Practices in the EU-28. Geneva: International Labour Organization, forthcoming (Igor Guardiancich and Oscar Molina, eds).
Le pensioni italiane al nodo equità, Centro Einaudi, Torino, 10 giugno. Presentazione: Pensions in Central and Eastern Europe: Why It Went Wrong?

8th Pan-European Conference on the European Union organized by the ECPR Standing Group on the European Union (SGEU), University of Trento, Trento, 16-18 June 2016. Presentazione del paper: Pensions and Post-Crisis European Policymaking: A Mapping Exercise (Igor Guardiancich and Mattia Guidi); Chair del panel: EU and Labour Market Policy
Slovenia and Central Europe: 25 Years later, Ljubljana, 20 June, Organized by Fokus 2031 Partecipazione al dibattito: Political development

11th ILERA European Congress "The Future of Representation", Milan, Italy, 8-10 September 2016. Presentazione del paper: Post-Crisis Social Dialogue in the EU-28: Revitalization, Innovation or Enduring Crisis (Oscar Molina, Igor Guardiancich and Christian Welz)

Nona conferenza annuale ESPAnet Italia: Modelli di welfare e modelli di capitalismo: Le sfide per lo sviluppo socio-economico in Italia e in Europa, Macerata, 22-24 settembre 2016. Presentazione del paper: Pensions and Post-Crisis European Policymaking: A Mapping Exercise (Igor Guardiancich and Mattia Guidi)

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Collaborazione in svariati progetti di ricerca presso l'ILO (International Labour Organization) - Industrial and Employment Relations Department el'ITC-ILO (ILO International Training Centre), tra cui: 1) Post Crisis Social Dialogue – Best and Innovative Practices in the EU-28 (2015-16); 2) Promoting a Balanced and Inclusive Recovery from Crisis in Europe through Sound Industrial Relations and Social Dialogue. Stock Taking Exercise: Best Practices of Social Dialogue and Crisis Recovery in New EU Member States (2012-13); 3) Social Dialogue and Pension Reform in Times of Crisis and Beyond (2011)
EuVisions, parte del proggetto ERC: REScEU (Reconciling Economic and Social Europe): Collaborazione con le pubblicazioni online 'Focus' e 'Intellectual Europe Review'

Kosovo Stability Initiative progetto ‘Support to Social Dialogue in Kosovo through capacity building and reorganization of social partners’. Rapporto scientifico: Reform of Pensions Systems in Transition Countries: Options for Kosovo

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: European Centre Natolin, Poland – Paderewski Grant for research on Polish affairs.
Rivista Italiana di Politiche Pubbliche – Premio Giovani Studiosi. Miglio paper nel 2008: Lessons from the New Pension Orthodoxy for Central, Eastern and Southeastern Europe.

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Svariate collaborazioni con l'Università degli Studi di Milano – Facoltà di Scienze Politiche. Programma di ricerca scientifica di rilevante interesse nazionale (PRIN), Ministero dell'Università e della Ricerca: Towards a Multi-Level Social Citizenship Space? Dilemmas and Perspectives of Social Europe (Prof. Maurizio Ferrera). Progetti di ricerca: 1) Pan-European pension funds (2009); 2) Fonds de Pensions Nestlé OFP (2010)

Collaborazione in svariati progetti di ricerca presso l'OSE (Observatoire social européen) e l'ETUI (European Trade Union Institute) tra i quali vanno segnalati: 1) The New Pension Mix: Supplementary Schemes in Europe (2011); 2) EU Social Policies – Monitoring and Analysis: Private Pensions (2009)

Progetto di ricerca della Friedrich Ebert Stiftung. Welfare States in Transition. The Development of the Welfare States of Slovenia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, Serbia and Macedonia, after the disintegration of Yugoslavia up to present date. Rapporto (e capitolo in curatela): Slovenian Social Policy in a Consensual Political System: The Dilemmas of a Delayed Transition.

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: James Madison University in Florence. Master in Political Science. Corsi tenuti durante gli AA 2009-2011: 1) Topics in Economic Policy. Policy-making in the European Union (con T. Jonjic); 2) Policy-Making Processes and Lobbying in the European Union (con A. Wilson); 3) Topics in Justice and Social Policy. New Forms of Policy-making in the European Union (con A. Wilson).

Guest lectures tenute in svariate università estere e/o attraverso programmi di scambio: 1) Central European University, Institute for Advanced Studies; 2) Università degli Studi di Milano (Erasmus+ negli AA 2014-15 e 2015-16); 3) University of Windsor; 4) University of Denver, Center for the Study of Europe and the World; 5) University of Michigan, Center for European Studies; 6) Fairfield-Princeton University Summer Programme in Florence; 7) Universiteit Antwerpen

University of Michigan, Department of Political Science. Corso tenuto durante l'AA 2011-2012: 1) Undergraduate Seminar in Comparative and Foreign Government. The Political Economy of Transition in Europe.

University of Southern Denmark, Odense, Danimarca. Corsi tenuti durante l'AA 2015-2016: 1) M.Sc. in International Business, Language and Culture – The Welfare Society in an International Perspective; 2) European Master of Social Work – Comparative Social Policy. Corsi tenuti durante l'AA 2014-2015: 1) M.Sc. in International Business, Language and Culture – The Welfare Society in an International Perspective; 2) M.A. Comparative Public Policies and Welfare Studies – The Political Economy of Transition in Europe: From the Collapse of Socialism to the Global Financial Crisis; 3) M.A. Comparative Public Policies and Welfare Studies – Comparative Welfare State Policies. European Master of Social Work – Comparative Social Policy. Corsi tenuti durante l'AA 2013-2014: 1) Master Comparative Public Policies and Welfare Studies – Comparative Welfare State Policies (con R. Careja, J. Kvist, P. Starke); 2) European Master of Social Work – Comparative Social Policy; 3) Scandinavian Area Studies – Comparative Welfare State Studies (con R. Careja, J. Kvist); 4) M.Sc. in International Business, Language and Culture – The Welfare Society in an International Perspective.

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: Progetto di ricerca della ERSTE Foundation Social Research Fellowship “Generations in Dialogue”: Distributive Recalibration and Pension Reforms in Eastern Europe: The Uncertain Future of Socially Endangered Groups.
Réponse à l’appel d’offre «Assurer un pension adéquat dans un contexte européen» du SPF Sécurité Sociale, vinto e coordinato da un team dell'OSE (Observatoire social européen)

Collaborazione nel progetto di ricerca bandito da European Commission - Employment, Social Affairs and Equal Opportunities DG, EMPL/E.3: Scope of the co-ordination system in the pension field’ (VT/2010/104), vinto e coordinato da un team dell'OSE (Observatoire social européen)

Programma ‘Reforming the Welfare State Institutions’ presso il Department of Political Science and Public Management, University of Southern Denmark. Progetti di ricerca: 1) Pensions in the EU: An Overhauled Institutional Configuration (2015-16); 2) Portability of Supplementary Pension Rights in Europe (2014-15)
